intro: Acetosella ambigua, commonly known as the ambiguous sorrel, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its leaves contain oxalic acid, giving them a tangy, sour taste. Acetosella ambigua is often found in temperate regions and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
